Chandler is the marketing executive at PMO Advertising Agency.  She has a marketing budget of $\$2500$ to pay for television and newspaper advertising. Television advertising  costs $\$100$ per minute and newspaper ad space costs $\$25$ per square centimeter of print.

**Write an *inequality* that represents the number of minutes of television advertising $(T)$ and square centimeters of newspaper advertising $(N)$ Chandler can order without exceeding her marketing budget.**

[[☃ expression 1]]

**Graph the constraint equation with $T$ on the horizontal axis and $N$ on the vertical axis.**

**If Chandler orders $18$ minutes of television advertising $(T)$, which of the following numbers of square centimeters of newspaper advertising $(N)$ can she order without exceeding the marketing budget?**
